title: JPMorgan American (LON:JAM) Shares Down 0.9% - Here's Why
text:
JPMorgan American (LON:JAM) Shares Down 0.9% - Here's Why Written by MarketBeat January 14, 2026 Share Link copied to clipboard. Image from MarketBeat Media, LLC. Key Points Shares of JPMorgan American (LON:JAM) fell 0.9% midday to GBX 1,114 (intraday low GBX 1,111.59), with trading volume ~677,318 shares— up 83% from the average daily volume. The trust has a market cap of £1.89 billion, a P/E of 25.21 and a beta of 0.65, with a 50‑day moving average of GBX 1,121.16 and a 200‑day moving average of GBX 1,092.84. JPMorgan American is a large, actively managed investment trust that aims for long‑term US equity returns by focusing on reasonably priced, high‑quality large‑cap stocks broadly diversified across the S&P 500. Five stocks we like better than JPMorgan American . Get JPMorgan American alerts: Sign Up Shares of JPMorgan American ( LON:JAM - Get Free Report ) were down 0.9% during mid-day trading on Wednesday . The stock traded as low as GBX 1,111.59 and last traded at GBX 1,114. Approximately 677,318 shares changed hands during trading, an increase of 83% from the average daily volume of 370,104 shares. The stock had previously closed at GBX 1,124. JPMorgan American Stock Performance
The firm has a market cap of £1.89 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 25.21 and a beta of 0.65. The stock has a 50-day moving average of GBX 1,121.16 and a 200-day moving average of GBX 1,092.84. JPMorgan American Company Profile ( Get Free Report )
A local knows the best route JPMorgan American Investment Trust plc aims to generate attractive long-term returns from the world's largest stock market by focusing on high quality companies that are also reasonably priced. Key points: Expertise - Our flagship US investment trust, managed by locally based specialist investors to provide core portfolio exposure to North American equities. Portfolio - Managed for growth by focusing on quality companies that are reasonably priced. Results - Broadly diversified across the S&P 500 index, with a focus on large cap stocks. Why invest in this trust The JPMorgan American Investment Trust plc is a large, actively managed investment trust investing in the core US stock market. Further Reading
